definitions.definition: A set of pieces that work together in unison as a mechanism or device .
examples: In order to change the bearing, you must first remove the gearbox assembly .

definitions.definition: The act or process of putting together a set of pieces, fragments, or elements.
A congregation of people in one place for a purpose.

examples: the General Assembly of the United Nations

definitions.definition: ( military ) A beat of the drum or sound of the bugle as a signal to troops to assemble.

( computing , Microsoft .NET ) A building block of an application , similar to a DLL , but containing both executable code and information normally found in a DLL's type library. The type library information in an assembly, called a manifest , describes public functions , data , classes , and version information .

main_definition: A set of pieces that work together in unison as a mechanism or device .
secondary_definitions: The act or process of putting together a set of pieces, fragments, or elements.
A congregation of people in one place for a purpose.
( military ) A beat of the drum or sound of the bugle as a signal to troops to assemble.

( computing , Microsoft .NET ) A building block of an application , similar to a DLL , but containing both executable code and information normally found in a DLL's type library. The type library information in an assembly, called a manifest , describes public functions , data , classes , and version information .

definitions.definition: assembly language ( programming language using mnemonics that correspond to processor instructions )

main_definition: ( computing ) assembly language ( programming language using mnemonics that correspond to processor instructions )
